Detailed Description

Coordinates the game classes and runs the game.

This class is responsible for gluing together the AI and human input modules to play a game of Connect Four. You will not need to modify the contents of this class, though it may be useful to glance over its contents before writing your AI implementation.

Author:
Leonid Shamis

final AIModule[]  players,
final int  AI_time 
)

Primary Constructor.

Constructs a new GameController that pulls together the various pieces of the program.

Parameters:
game The game to arbitrate.
io An IO module to use for graphics output and human input.
players An array of two AIModules that will be pitted against each other.
AI_time Maximum amount of time alotted per AI move.

Definition at line 31 of file GameController.java.

Member Function Documentation

void GameController.callAI ( final AIModule  ai,
final String  AIName 
) [private]

Gets the next move from the AI.

Given an AI module, extracts the move from that module. The AI will have a set period of time in which to choose a move.

Parameters:
ai The AIModule to call.
AIName Label given to the AI.
See also:
AIModule

Start the gameplay.

Runs the game.

Definition at line 45 of file GameController.java.

void GameController.tryMakeMove ( final int  move  )  [private]

Attempts to make the given move, defaulting to an arbitrary move otherwise.

Given a move, attempts to play that move. If the move is illegal, the GameController will pick an arbitrary move instead and will report an error.

Parameters:
move The column in which to drop the coin.
